dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Back in 2021, Mary Barra just announced GM is budgeting an additional $7 billion for EV development through 2026.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Back in twenty twenty one, Mary Barra just announced G M is budgeting an additional seven dollars billion for E V development through twenty twenty six.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We will invest an additional $7 billion in EVs through 2025. bringing our total investment in EV and (autonomous vehicles) to over $27 billion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and she didn't even mention Tesla once in that Barclays conference. It's like they're laser-focused on their own game plan.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and she didn't even mention Tesla once in that Barclays conference. It's like they're laser-focused on their own game plan.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Tesla wasnt mentioned in a presentation by CEO and Chairman Mary Barra to Barclays Global Automotive conference, but the Detroit-based companys aggressive strategic shift includes becoming the North American market share leader in the technology over the next few years.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right? They're aiming to be the North American market share leader in EVs within five years. That's a huge shift for a company that, you know, kind of walked away from electric with the EV1 years ago.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? They're aiming to be the North American market share leader in EVs within five years. That's a huge shift for a company that, you know, kind of walked away from electric with the EV1 years ago.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Were committed to fighting for EV market share until we are number one in North America. GM was a pioneer in battery-powered cars, releasing the EV1 subcompact in California 24 years ago as an early test vehicle, its abandonment of the technology created an opportunity for Musk and Tesla in the early 2000s.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly—they were actually pioneers back then, but then they're coming back strong now. They've got thirty new battery-powered models planned globally by 2026.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly-they were actually pioneers back then, but then they're coming back strong now. They've got thirty new battery-powered models planned globally by twenty twenty six.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The biggest U.S. automaker plans to release 30 battery-powered models globally by 2025, two-thirds of which will be available to North American customers from its Cadillac, GMC, Chevrolet and Buick brands.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And two-thirds of those are for North America—across Cadillac, GMC, Buick, Chevrolet. The Hummer EV and Cadillac Lyriq are just the beginning.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And two-thirds of those are for North America-across Cadillac, G M C, Buick, Chevrolet. The Hummer E V and Cadillac Lyriq are just the beginning.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The biggest U.S. automaker plans to release 30 battery-powered models globally by 2025, two-thirds of which will be available to North American customers from its Cadillac, GMC, Chevrolet and Buick brands.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Their Ultium battery tech is a big deal too—costs are already forty percent lower than the Bolt's current batteries, and they're saying the next gen will be sixty percent cheaper.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Their Ultium battery tech is a big deal too-costs are already forty percent lower than the Bolt's current batteries, and they're saying the next gen will be sixty percent cheaper.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: GM says it will be able to sell electric vehicles with range of up to 400 miles per charge at a profit, owing to costs for its Ultium batteries that are about 40% below those currently used in its Bolt EV. A next-generation Ultium that arrives in a few years will be 60% cheaper than Bolt batteries and may offer a range of up to 450 miles per charge, said Doug Parks, GMs executive vice president for product development, purchasing and supply chain.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Which means they can sell EVs with up to 400 miles of range profitably. That's a game-changer if they pull it off.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which means they can sell EVs with up to four hundred miles of range profitably. That's a game-changer if they pull it off.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: GM says it will be able to sell electric vehicles with range of up to 400 miles per charge at a profit, owing to costs for its Ultium batteries that are about 40% below those currently used in its Bolt EV.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And they're hiring, like, 3,000 new tech workers just in Q1 next year to support all this. It feels like they're really going all-in.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And they're hiring, like, three thousand new tech workers just in Q1 next year to support all this. It feels like they're really going all-in.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Earlier this month, GM said it would hire 3,000 new tech workers before the end of 2021s first quarter to help with the accelerated EV push.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But still, Tesla's market cap is sitting at $473 billion. GM's playing catch-up in valuation, even if their production scale is way bigger right now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But still, Tesla's market cap is sitting at four hundred seventy three dollars billion. G M's playing catch-up in valuation, even if their production scale is way bigger right now.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Teslas steady sales and production growth and its recent run of five profitable quarters, the longest such stretch in company history, along with Musks uncommonly loyal fanbase, have made it the worlds most valuable automaker with a market capitalization of $473 billion. And while its addition to the S&P 500 index fueled a 22% jump in the stock so far this week, Teslas production capacity and earnings are a fraction of GMs.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: True, but Musk is expanding fast too—new factories in Germany and Texas. Still, it'll take time to match GM's global footprint.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: True, but Musk is expanding fast too-new factories in Germany and Texas. Still, it'll take time to match G M's global footprint.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Musk is racing to open new factories in Germany and Texas, in addition to its main California plant and new Shanghai Gigafactory, though it will be several years before it can match the scale of GMs global production operations.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: I think the regulatory push helps—Biden's administration prioritizing electric transport, tougher emissions rules… it all plays into this strategy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I think the regulatory push helps-Biden's administration prioritizing electric transport, tougher emissions rules... it all plays into this strategy.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Lower costs for batteries and components, tougher global rules to limit CO2 emissions and the incoming Biden Administration thats prioritizing electric transportation underpins the companys new strategy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And Barra said they control everything it takes to lead. Confident words, but they've got a lot of ground to cover.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Barra said they control everything it takes to lead. Confident words, but they've got a lot of ground to cover.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Our work to accelerate our EV and technology leadership is a significant undertaking, but we know we control everything it takes to lead and to win, Barra said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. It's gonna be fascinating to watch this play out over the next few years.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. It's gonna be fascinating to watch this play out over the next few years.
